dt: {bc}a steel-tipped spear carried by mounted knights or light cavalry
{bc}any of various sharp objects suggestive of a lance: such as
{bc}a spear used for killing whales or fish

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}lancea{/it}
shortdef: a steel-tipped spear carried by mounted knights or light cavalry
any of various sharp objects suggestive of a lance: such as

dt: {bc}any of several small elongate marine bony fishes (genus {it}Ammodytes{/it} of the family Ammodytidae) that associate in large schools and remain buried in sandy beaches at ebb tide

shortdef: any of several small elongate marine bony fishes (genus Ammodytes of the family Ammodytidae) that associate in large schools and remain buried in sandy beaches at ebb tide —called also sand eel, sand launce
